alert.note: Alert for Pike; Wayne (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 22 at 5:29PM EDT until April 22 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Binghamton has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Sullivan County in central New York... East central Wayne County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Pike County in northeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 615 PM EDT. * At 529 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Bushkill, or 14 miles east of Mount Pocono, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Bushkill, Monticello, Lackawaxen, Blooming Grove, Bethel, Damascus, Callicoon, Shohola, Tusten and Cochecton. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Heavy rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
